Name: Point Tag ID
Description: Identification name for specific AI. Values must be printable ASCII characters.

Name: Units Tag
Description: Describes the units used by the AI. Values must be printable ASCII characters.

Name: Scanning
Description: If disabled, field inputs are ignored and no changes will occur unless manually entered. Valid values are 0 (Disabled) and 1 (Enabled).

Name: Scan Period
Description: Number of seconds between updates of the AI.

Name: Actual Scan Time
Description: Actual number of seconds between updates of the AI.

Name: Filter
Description: Percentage of last raw A/D reading to be weighted with the new raw A/D reading.

Name: Averaging
Description: If enabled, the filtered raw A/D value is averaged over the Scan Period. If disabled, the current filtered raw A/D value is used when the Scan Period is reached. Valid values are 0 (Disabled) and 1 (Enabled).

Name: Raw A/D Input
Description: Raw A/D reading used to calculate the EU Value (parameter #21).

Name: Zero Raw
Description: Lowest calibrated raw A/D input.

Name: Mid Point Raw #1
Description: Second lowest calibrated raw A/D input.

Name: Mid Point Raw #2
Description: Third lowest or highest calibrated raw A/D input.

Name: Mid Point Raw #3
Description: Second highest calibrated raw A/D input.

Name: Span Raw
Description: Highest calibrated raw A/D input.

Name: Zero EU
Description: Lowest calibrated EU value.

Name: Mid Point EU #1
Description: Second lowest calibrated EU value.

Name: Mid Point EU #2
Description: Third lowest or highest calibrated EU value.

Name: Mid Point EU #3
Description: Second highest calibrated EU value.

Name: Span EU
Description: Highest calibrated EU value. When this parameter changes, parameters 14, 15, and 16 are set equal to this value.

Name: Offset (Zero Shift)
Description: Value to be added to all calculated EU values.

Name: Set Value
Description: Desired EU value for a calibration point. Note: No event is logged for this parameter. and should possibly labeled as R/O in any external ROC Plus Protocol Specification.

Name: Manual Value
Description: Current EU value of AI while performing calibration.

Name: EU Value
Description: Value in Engineering Units.

Name: Clipping
Description: If enabled, then the EU Value (parameter #21) cannot be less than the Low Low Alarm EU (parameter #23) or greater than the High High Alarm EU (parameter #26). Valid values are 0 (Disabled, no limiting of the EU value, Parameter 21, occurs) and 1 (Enabled).

Name: Low Low Alarm EU
Description: Alarm value for Low Low Alarm and minimum EU Value (parameter #21) if clipping (parameter #22) is enabled.

Name: Low Alarm EU
Description: Alarm value for Low Alarm.

Name: High Alarm EU
Description: Alarm value for High Alarm.

Name: High High Alarm EU
Description: Alarm value for High High Alarm and maximum EU Value (parameter #21) if clipping (parameter #22) is enabled.

Name: Rate Alarm EU
Description: Alarm value for maximum change of EU Value (parameter #21) between Scan Periods.

Name: Alarm Deadband
Description: Provides a range (±) that the EU Value (parameter #21) may move between without causing another alarm.

Name: Alarming
Description: If enabled, alarms may be generated and sent to the Alarm Log. Valid values are 0 (Disabled) and 1 (Enabled).

Name: SRBX on Clear
Description: Indicates a SRBX alarm is desired if an alarm condition clears. Valid values are 0 (SRBX on Clear Disabled) and 1 (SRBX on Clear Enabled).

Name: SRBX on Set
Description: Indicates a SRBX alarm is desired if an alarm condition occurs. Valid values are 0 (SRBX on Set Disabled) and 1 (SRBX on Set Enabled).

Name: Low Alarm
Description: If set, the EU Value (parameter #21) is less than or equal to the Low Alarm EU (parameter #24). If clear, the EU Value (parameter #21) is greater than the Low Alarm EU (parameter #24).

Name: Low Low Alarm
Description: If set, the EU Value (parameter #21) is less than or equal to the Low Low Alarm EU (parameter #23). If clear, the EU Value (parameter #21) is greater than the Low Low Alarm EU (parameter #23).

Name: High Alarm
Description: If set, the EU Value (parameter #21) is greater than or equal to the High Alarm EU (parameter #25). If clear, the EU Value (parameter #21) is less than the High Alarm EU (parameter #25).

Name: High High Alarm
Description: If set, the EU Value (parameter #21) is greater than or equal to the High High Alarm EU (parameter #26). If clear, the EU Value (parameter #21) is less than the High High Alarm EU (parameter #26).

Name: Rate Alarm
Description: If set, the EU Value (parameter #21) change from last Scan Period to the new Scan Period is greater than or equal to the Rate Alarm EU (parameter #27). If clear, the EU Value (parameter #21) change from last Scan Period to the new Scan Period is less than the Rate Alarm EU (parameter #27).

Name: Not Used
Description: Not used

Name: Point Fail Alarm
Description: If set, the AI’s hardware is reporting a malfunction. If clear, the AI’s hardware is operating properly.

Name: Scanning Disabled Alarm
Description: If set, the Scanning (parameter #2) has been disabled. If clear, the Scanning (parameter #2) has been enabled.

Name: Calibration Timer
Description: Number of seconds until a calibration timeout occurs.

Name: Calibration Mode
Description: Indicates what the calibration for the AI is doing. Valid values are: 0 = Use Current Calibration, 1 = Start Calibration, 2 = Calibrate, 3 = Restore Previous Calibration, 4 = Stop Calibration. Note: No event is logged for this parameter. and should possibly labeled as R/O in any external ROC Plus Protocol Specification.

Name: Calibration Type
Description: During calibration, determines what value the Set Value (parameter #19) replaces. Valid values are: 0 = Nothing, 1 = Set Zero, 2 = Set Span, 3 = Set Mid Point #1, 4 = Set Mid Point #2, 5 = Set Mid Point #3, 6 = Set Offset (Zero Shift). Note: No event is logged for this parameter. and should possibly labeled as R/O in any external ROC Plus Protocol Specification.

Name: Failsafe Mode
Description: Valid values are 0 (Disabled) and 1 (Enabled, the EU Value is set to the Failsafe value in the event of a point fail).

Name: Failsafe Value
Description: The AI’s EU Value is set to the Failsafe Value if Failsafe Mode is Enabled and the AI is in Point Fail.

Name: AI Type
Description: Indicates the type of AI module (12 or 16 bit). Valid values are 0 (AI 12 Bit) and 1 (AI 16 Bit).

Name: Equivalent Milliamp Value
Description: Output of module scaled to a 4 to 20 value to be equivalent to milliamps.
